byline.original: By RUSS BUETTNER and CHARLES V. BAGLI

abstract: Examination by New York Times of legal documents reveals Donald Trump profited off failing casino empire in Atlantic City, shifting debt burden onto casinos and investors; Trump borrowed money at unsustainable rate in effort to hang onto casinos that floundered even as others succeeded; while some still appreciate thousands of jobs Trump once brought to city, others condemn his poor management and its aftermath.

headline.print_headline: How Trump Profited on Failed Casinos
headline.main: How Donald Trump Bankrupted His Atlantic City Casinos, but Still Earned Millions

keywords.value: Trump Plaza Hotel & Casino (Atlantic City, NJ)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Mr. Trump boasts of his success at the Jersey Shore resort, but regulatory reviews, court records and security filings indicate otherwise. And others paid the price.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump boasts of his success at the Jersey Shore resort, but regulatory reviews, court records and security filings indicate otherwise. And others paid the price.
